edu.rit.image

Class ColorApngWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.image.ColorApngWriter

  • public class ColorApngWriter
extends Object
    Class ColorApngWriter provides an object for writing a 24-bit color APNG animated image. To write an animated image:

    1. Create an instance of class ColorApngWriter, specifying the image dimensions, number of frames, number of plays, and the output stream to which to write the image.

    2. Call the writer's getImageQueue() method to get the writer's image queue, which is an instance of class ColorImageQueue.

    3. For each frame of the animated image:

      1. Generate rows of pixel data and put them into the image queue by calling the image queue's put() method. Each row of pixel data must be stored in a ColorArray whose length is equal to the number of columns in the image. Each element of the array specifies the color for one pixel. You must call the image queue's put() method once for every row of pixels in the frame. You do not have to put the rows in any particular order.

      2. Call the writer's writeFrame() method to write the frame's pixel data to the APNG animated image.

    Steps 3a and 3b can be performed concurrently in separate threads. In Step 3a, multiple threads can put the pixel data rows into the image queue concurrently.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorApngWriter

        public ColorApngWriter(int frames,
               int rows,
               int cols,
               int plays,
               short delayNumer,
               short delayDenom,
               OutputStream out)
        Construct a new color APNG writer. The APNG animated image consists of the given number of frames. Each frame consists of the given number of rows and columns. The animation will be played the given number of times. Each frame will be displayed for the given number of seconds, expressed as a fraction delayNumer/delayDenom. (Use the writeFrame(short,short) method to specify a different delay for a certain frame.) The APNG animated image will be written to the given output stream.
        Parameters:
        frames - Number of frames. Must be ≥ 1.
        rows - Number of rows. Must be ≥ 1.
        cols - Number of columns. Must be ≥ 1.
        plays - Number of plays. Must be ≥ 1, or 0 to loop infinitely.
        delayNumer - Frame display delay numerator. Must be ≥ 0.
        delayDenom - Frame display delay denominator. Must be ≥ 0.
        out - Output stream.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if any argument is illegal.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if out is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getImageQueue

        public ColorImageQueue getImageQueue()
        Returns this color APNG writer's image queue.
        Returns:
        Image queue.

      • writeFrame

        public void writeFrame()
                throws IOException,
                       InterruptedException
        Write this color PNG writer's next frame to the underlying output stream. This frame will be displayed for the number of seconds specified to the constructor. The pixel data is obtained from the image queue. The underlying output stream is closed once all frames have been written.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
        InterruptedException - Thrown if the calling thread is interrupted while blocked in this method.

      • writeFrame

        public void writeFrame(short delayNumer,
              short delayDenom)
                throws IOException,
                       InterruptedException
        Write this color PNG writer's next frame to the underlying output stream. This frame will be displayed for the given number of seconds, expressed as a fraction delayNumer/delayDenom. The pixel data is obtained from the image queue. The underlying output stream is closed once all frames have been written.
        Parameters:
        delayNumer - Frame display delay numerator. Must be ≥ 0.
        delayDenom - Frame display delay denominator. Must be ≥ 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if any argument is illegal.
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
        InterruptedException - Thrown if the calling thread is interrupted while blocked in this method.
